field_edited_text.value:
Overall
Goal:

Maximize the
use of a
unique
resource



The harbor is not only a valuable
resource for the City, State and nation, it is
also a scarce resource. While many small
ports have been established along the Che-
sapeake Bay during the past 300 years only
Baltimore had the combination of water,
rail, roads, labor, capital, and civic leader-
ship to grow into a world port. Few states
have a harbor which offers such a diverse
opportunity for industrial and maritime
development, recreation, housing and pub-
lic access as the Port of Baltimore.

Because of the limited amount of land
with direct access to shipping channels very
little of the shoreline remains vacant or
available for future development. To insure
that a limited resource, the Port, is utilized
to maximize its positive economic impact
every effort should be made by the City,
State and private sector to provide both
adequate, modern terminals facilities and
secure suitable development opportunities
for growth industries that are capital and
job intensive. This will require identifying
sites and improvements that can satisfy
industrial and commercial activities with a
particular need for locating in the port and
also meet the objectives of the diverse mar-
ltime operations.



98
